column3:
Design at the GSA covers a wide spectrum of activity. From the traditional crafts of silversmithing, jewellery design and ceramics to the design of products, interiors, textiles and communication, the diversity of our specialisms is bound together by a common goal - to produce excellent designers.

We are committed to the development of design education, practice and research, in the highly creative environment of the GSA where artists, designers and architects study and have the opportunity to work together. Learning and teaching is studio-based, complemented by a programme of Historical and Critical Studies and visiting lecturers, critics and honorary professors.

Design School students are successful and a high number go on to postgraduate study at the RCA, while others choose to develop their career in the creative industries with many setting up their own businesses or working for major international companies. Our students show work annually at New Designers and D&AD in London, at Premier Vision, Paris, and have been invited to exhibit at the Furniture Fair in Milan.

Our staff are practicing designers as well as academics and are all involved in their own practice and research projects and regularly exhibit internationally and nationally.

Welcome to the School of Design.

column4: • The School of Design has around 650 full-time undergraduate students and a growing postgraduate population with a growing number of full-time PhD students.
• The School comprises seven departments specialising in: ceramics, textiles, silversmithing and jewellery, interior design, visual communication, product design and product design engineering.

<li>Innovative courses include the Bachelor of Design/Master of European Design, the Bachelor of Engineering/Master of Engineering and a part-time distance ceramics degree course by mixed-mode delivery
• Graduate destinations include Asprey's London, Diesel, BBC, Orange, Dyson, Wedgwood and Conran.
• The Masters in Design Practice: Textiles as Fashion was the first of its kind in the UK
• The Centre of Advanced Textiles (CAT) is a unique research centre specialising in new methods of computerised textile design and digital printing.
• Excellent links with industry and business through staff consultancy and practice including One Foot Taller, Monsoon, Accessorise, Giltech, Psion, Nokia and Bulmers.
• The Atrium Gallery has diverse and energetic programme, attracting international exhibitions from Korea, Japan and Budapest, as well as hosting outstanding student and staff design shows.

• The School was listed in the Design Week magazine HOT 50 - as a leader in design education. In 2002 the School of Design became one of only two European Design Schools to be invited to join an alliance of Adobe Software and 24 of the leading Design Schools in the USA.

• Honorary professors include Josephine Green, Director of Trends and Strategy at Philips Electronics, Holland, Janice Kirkpatrick, Director of Graven Images, Glasgow, Stefan Klein of the Bratislava Academy of Fine Art and Design Slovakia, Russell Mills, Multimedia artists, designer and architect Martine Bedin and Tony Franks from ECA.
